New Records: South Korea secured a 3-0 victory over China in their 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifier.
Son Heung-min scored a brace and assisted one goal, contributing significantly to the win.
Hwang Hee-chan scored a penalty goal in the 11th minute, giving South Korea the lead.
Jung Seung-hyun scored the third goal for South Korea with a header from a free kick cross by Son Heung-min.
Key Match Events: South Korea dominated possession with 65% and had 18 shots, 13 more than China.
Son Heung-min converted a penalty after Hwang Hee-chan was fouled in the box.
Son Heung-min scored his second goal with a header from a corner kick.
The match saw a decisive penalty and a well-timed header for the third goal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Korea led Group C with two straight wins after the match.
China had a close-range shot by Tan Long that missed the post in the 42nd minute.
The match was followed by Thailand's 3-1 victory over Singapore in another Group C match.
Others: The match was part of the 2026 FIFA World Cup Asian Zone qualifying tournament's second stage.
The top two teams from each group advance to the third stage.
